main event: A very bright light followed by an orange streak or exhaust was observed at Dhahran Air Field in Saudi Arabia on September 26, 1960.
interesting points: The object was observed at a very high elevation angle, between 70 to 80 degrees, almost directly overhead.
The orange streak or exhaust was estimated to subtend an angle distance of 10 degrees.
The direction of movement was from southeast to northeast.
The bright light appeared first, followed by the streak of flame.
The entire sighting lasted for only 5 seconds, which the observer stated was distinctly different from any shooting star they had ever seen.
sighted object: a very bright light followed by an orange streak or exhaust
witnesses: weather observer from Detachment 1221 Weather Squadron
